intro: Mauria glauca, commonly known as the bluebush, is a low-growing shrub native to the arid regions of Australia. It features dense, compact foliage with a striking blue-gray coloration due to the presence of fine hairs on its leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in winter, adding a delicate contrast to its foliage. It is well adapted to drought and poor soils, making it a hardy plant in harsh environments. Mauria glauca is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
